byline.contributor: Elisa Cho contributed reporting from New York.

abstract: Judge Andrew S Hanen, who issued February ruling temporarily halting Pres Obama's executive order shielding millions of illegal immigrants from deportation, is seen in Texas as fair and keenly intelligent jurist; Hanen has begun to issue increasingly dire warnings about what he sees as porous border with Mexico.
lead_paragraph: Andrew S. Hanen of Federal District Court, who has raised alarms about what he sees as a porous border, is considered a conservative and keenly analytical jurist.

headline.main: Judge Blocking Plan for Immigrants Is Praised as Fair in Texas
headline.print_headline: Judge Blocking Plan for Immigrants Is Praised as Fair in Texas

snippet: Andrew S. Hanen of Federal District Court, who has raised alarms about what he sees as a porous border, is considered a conservative and keenly analytical jurist.
